pageTitle: Itinerary for Monday, November 6, 2017 | Prime Minister of Canada
articleHtml:
Itinerary for the Prime Minister, Justin Trudeau, for Monday, November 6, 2017:

Ottawa, Ontario

8:30 a.m. The Prime Minister will attend the Cabinet meeting.

Note for media:

  • Ministers will be available to media in the House of Commons Foyer as of 11 a.m.

11:25 a.m. The Prime Minister will meet with Canada’s Ambassador-designate to France, Isabelle Hudon.

Prime Minister’s Office
Centre Block, Parliament Hill

Note for media:

  • Photo opportunity at the beginning of the meeting

12:30 p.m. The Prime Minister will meet with His Eminence Cardinal Gérald Lacroix, Archbishop of Quebec.

Prime Minister’s Office
Centre Block, Parliament Hill

Note for media:

  • Photo opportunity at the beginning of the meeting

2 p.m. The Prime Minister will attend Question Period. Following Question Period, he will deliver a speech marking the 150th anniversary of the first House of Commons sitting.

Montréal, Quebec

7:30 p.m. The Prime Minister will attend the Leonard Cohen tribute concert and deliver brief remarks.

Bell Centre
1909 avenue des Canadiens-de-Montréal

Note for media:

  • Pooled coverage for remarks at 7:55 p.m.

9:15 p.m. The Prime Minister will depart Montréal for Hanoi, Vietnam.

Air Inuit Terminal
6005 Côte-Vertu
Ville St-Laurent

Notes for media:

  • Photo opportunity for departure
  • Media should arrive no later than 8:45 p.m.
